comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Circa 1970 view: www.slv.vic.gov.au/pcards/gid/slv-pic-aab11441/1/pc002372 Both the 1940 construction view and the circa 1970 view were taken from the vantage point of the then extant Hotel Manly which was quite a tall building. See view here of the Hotel Manly taken from the Wharf side of the street: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=75550 If memory serves me correctly, the Hotel Manly was demolished in about 1989.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] The buildings (bottom right in the photo above) may have been removed in the 1970 view but the buses look to be the same as those here! 

Thanks for the location of where the photo was taken, I have added it to the description above.

AB

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: AB - Yes, I thought that about the buses too. Lots of buses used as public transport in NSW were remarkably similar for a long time. The Bus Museum has got a pretty comprehensive collection, although not all models were used in NSW: www.sydneybusmuseum.com/fleet.htm

comment.author: 56215564@N07
comment._content:
Great photo - before my time but my parents were there then!
Note the Manly Swimming Baths on the left which was washed away in the 70's & is now the Manly Yacht Club.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/56215564@N07] Thanks for adding that little piece of history to this photo.

AB

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Manly ferry is either Dee Why or Curl Curl (sister vessels)
